newsitem.title: USA: J.P. Morgan emerging debt index up 1.2 pct in Dec.
newsitem.headline: J.P. Morgan emerging debt index up 1.2 pct in Dec.

text.p: J.P. Morgan and Co said its Emerging Market Bond Index (EMBI+) rose 1.2 percent in December, bringing its 1996 total return to 39.30 percent.
For the year, all 14 EMBI+ countries posted gains. Russia was the top performer, up 114.25 percent, while South Africa turned in the worst performance, rising 8.71 percent.
For the second consecutive month, Bulgaria topped the EMBI+ in December, gaining 5.25 percent.
Peru lagged the other EMBI+ countries in December, down 1.69 percent amid the continuing hostage crisis.
The J.P. Morgan Emerging Local Markets Index (ELMI) rose 1.06 percent in December and 14.86 percent overall in 1996.
Mexico topped the ELMI with gains of 2.86 percent in December, and all ELMI countries rose during the month.
